content.question: Two blocks are attached to horizontal springs and held at rest. The masses of the blocks and spring constants of the springs are labeled, and both spring-block systems initially have the same potential energy. The blocks are released at time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, and first reach their respective maximum displacements at time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. At time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>, the block on the left has a larger displacement from its point of release than the block on the right. Which of the following correctly compares the masses of the blocks?

choices.label: <math alttext="m sub 1 is less than m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="m sub 1 equals m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="m sub 1 is greater than m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
The comparison cannot be made without knowing the relative spring constants.

content.answer: <math alttext="m sub 1 is less than m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
